Sentence.sentence: Koehn pointed  out that this new era of corporate vocabulary is very "team"-oriented—and not by coincidence.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps,as the team suggests, it draws us to similar environments but there is more to it.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: The community mental health team saved my life.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: A team which is full of enthusiasm is more likely to win.
sentences.cn: 情绪高涨的球队更可能获胜。

sentences.en: Our team were wearing blue shorts.
sentences.cn: 我们队员穿着蓝色短裤。

sentences.en: He teamed up with a friend and set up a trade business.
sentences.cn: 他与一个朋友联合, 做起了买卖。

entry.def: A team is a group of people who play a particular sport or game together against other similar groups of people.

example.ex: The team failed to qualify for the African Nations Cup finals...
example.tran: 该队未能闯入非洲国家杯决赛。

example.ex: He had lost his place in the England team.
example.tran: 他失去了在英格兰队的位置。

entry.def: You can refer to any group of people who work together as a team .

example.ex: Each specialist consultant has a team of doctors under him...
example.tran: 每位会诊专家手下都有一组医生。

example.ex: The governors were joined by Mr Hunter and his management team.
example.tran: 亨特先生及他率领的管理小组加入了州长们的队伍。

means.word_mean: 2. two or more draft animals that work together to pull something

sentences.sentence: "We teamed up for this new project"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tēam 'team of draught animals', of Germanic origin; related to German Zaum 'bridle', also to teem and tow, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin ducere 'to lead'

means: The European-Atlantic Movement 欧洲-大西洋运动
Technique for Evaluation and Analysis of Maintainability 评价分析可维护性的技术
trauma evaluation and management 创伤评估和处理
transfemoral endovascular aneurysm management 经股血管内动脉瘤处理

sentences.cn: 团体比赛项目

sentences.en: the sales team

sentences.en: a team leader/member

sentences.en: A team of experts has/have been called in to investigate.

sentences.cn: 他被安排和哥哥搭档参加双打。
sentences.en: He was teamed with his brother in the doubles.

sentences.en: The governors were joined by Mr Hunter and his management team.

sentences.cn: 他们让另一支球队轻易地赢得了这场比赛.
sentences.en: They just handed the game to the other team on a plate.

sentences.cn: 球队正在准备迎接与邻近那所大学的比赛.
sentences.en: The team was pointing for the game with the neighbouring college.

sentences.cn: 我们等到有资格参加比赛时再来决定本队参赛人员.
sentences.en: We'll decide on our team as and when we qualify for the competition.

sentences.cn: 在一片以为他得了重病的猜测中,他被队里除名了.
sentences.en: He was dropped from the team amid speculation that he was seriously ill.

sentences.cn: 他是本地足球队的热情支持者.
sentences.en: He's an ardent supporter of the local football team.

sentences.cn: 队员们对裁判员的裁决感到非常气愤.
sentences.en: The team was left raging at the referee's decision.

sentences.cn: 日本队积四分,一胜两负.
sentences.en: The Japanese team accumulated four points with one win and two losses.

sentences.cn: 我设法拼凑一个球队参加明天的比赛.
sentences.en: I'll try to scrape a team together for tomorrow's game.

sentences.cn: 主队没得分.
sentences.en: The home team didn't score.

sentences.cn: 全校学生都希望该校足球队赢得那?热?
sentences.en: The whole school hopes that its football team will win the match.

sentences.cn: 情绪高涨的球队更可能获胜.
sentences.en: A team which is full of enthusiasm is more likely to win.

sentences.cn: 我们队在昨天的比赛中表现出色.
sentences.en: Our team performed well in the match yesterday.

sentences.cn: 那支队伍在首轮比赛中被淘汰了.
sentences.en: That team went out in the first round.

sentences.cn: 勘探队踏遍了祖国的山山水水.
sentences.en: The prospecting team has traversed the length and breadth of the land.

sentences.cn: 我们队以三比零获胜.
sentences.en: Our team won the game three nil.

sentences.cn: 我队昨天晚上打败了冠军,因而大家欣喜若狂.
sentences.en: Our team is licking its chops because we beat the champions last night.

sentences.cn: 企业各不相同,CEO许许多多,但大部分都自认为是教练,企业是自己的团队,他们想赢。”
sentences.en: There are lots  and lots of CEOs in very different companies, but most think of themselves as coaches and this is their team and they want to win.”

sentences.cn: 团队管理能够提供这种协调。
sentences.en: Team management provides for this coordination.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 如果想完全发挥出人员的潜力的话，团队管理需要新技能。
sentences.en: Team management calls for new skills if personnel potential is to be fully realized.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 此外，这个问题不仅仅是怎样让团队更有效率地合作，更是它如何与它要 服务的整个组织或社会结合在一起。
sentences.en: Furthermore, the issue is not just how the team can function more effectively, but how it integrates with the overall organization, or society that it supposes it serves.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 一群人不会自然而然地成为一个团 队。
sentences.en: A group of individuals is not automatically a team.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 这一领域的专 家 Casey 称团队内部的合作过程必须要组织好、促进好和管理好。
sentences.en: Casey, an expert in this field, suggests that the cooperation process within teams must be organized, promoted and managed.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 团结 一致后团队才能创造出新的、特色的、比单个成员做得更好的作品。
sentences.en: Together, the team may then produce something new, unique and superior to that of any one member.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 如果 一个团队的管理者表现出了这样的品质，那么团队作为一个整体就更能意识 到自己的潜力，从而实现自己的目标。
sentences.en: If a team manager exemplifies such qualities, then the team as a whole would be better able to realize their potential and achieve their objectives.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 为了发挥最大潜力，团队成员该如何做？。
sentences.en: What should team members do to fully realize their potential?.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 在有效的团队管理方面需要考虑些什么？。
sentences.en: What needs to be considered for effective team management?.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 今年早些时候，英国探险家Pen Hadow 和他的团队艰苦跋涉三个月穿越冰冻的北冰洋，对冰层进行测量并且记录观察情况。
sentences.en: Earlier this year, British explorer ?Hadow and his team trekked for three months across the frozen Arctic Ocean, taking measurements and recording observations about the ice.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 研究团队发现，锻炼使快速眼球运动的速度下降了大约8%，(33) 阻碍了眼睛捕捉新的视觉信息。
sentences.en: The team found that exerciser educed the speed of rapid eye movements by about 8%, 33 preventing their ability to capture new visual information.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 团队的趋势也从普通公司（比如美国通用电气公司和国际商用机器公司）发展到了一些更为特别的机构。
sentences.en: The fashion for teams is also spreading from the usual corporate suspects (such as GE and IBM) to some more unusual ones.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 克利夫兰诊所是一家医院运营商，已将其医疗人员重组成专注于特定治疗领域的团队；会诊医生、护士还有其他同事紧密合作，不再因专业和等级不同而被分隔开。
sentences.en: The Cleveland Clinic, a hospital operator, has reorganised its medical staff into teams to focus on particular treatment areas; consultants, nurses and others collaborate closely instead of being separated by speciality ( 专业)and rank.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 哈佛大学已故的Richard Hackman 曾表示：“毫无疑问，团队有可能创造奇迹，催生出非凡的事物……④但是不能太依赖团队。”
sentences.en: The late Richard Hackman of Harvard University once argued, “I have no question that when you have a team, the possibility exists that it will generate magic,producing something extraordinary… ④ But don’t count on it.”
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 有一项针对120 个高级主管团队的研究，研究发现，不到10% 的成员认可自己的团队伙伴。
sentences.en: In a study of 120 teams of senior executives, he discovered that less than 10% of their supposed members agreed on who exactly was on the team.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 劳动力所发生的剧烈变化使团队管理更加艰难。
sentences.en: Profound changes in the workforce are making teams trickier to manage.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但是，哈佛大学的Amy Edmondson指出，机构越来越多地将“团队”视为一个动词而不是名词：他们为了特定的目的组建团队，之后又快速将团队解散。
sentences.en: However, as Amy Edmondson of Harvard points out, organisations increasingly use “team” as a verb rather than a noun: they form teams for specific purposes and then quickly disband them.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 这个研究至少表明公司需要进一步思考如何管理团队。
sentences.en: The least that can be concluded from this research is that companies need to think harder about managing teams.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 他们需要摆脱感情用事：最成功的团队都会有这样的领导者，他们制定总体方向、快速采取行动。
sentences.en: They need to rid their minds of sentimentalism ( 感情用事):the most successful teams have leaders who are able to set an overall direction and take immediate action.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 他们需要保持团队精简和专注：屈服于压力而变得更“包容”必然会导致功能紊乱。
sentences.en: They need to keep teams small and focused: giving in to pressure to be more “inclusive” is a guarantee of dysfunction.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 亚马逊公司的老板Jeff Bezos 说：“如果我看到一顿午饭超过两个比萨饼，那么这个团队就太庞大了。”
sentences.en: Jeff Bezos,Amazon’s boss, says that “If I see more than two pizzas for lunch, the team is too big.”
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但是，比起如何更好地管理团队，组织机构需要学习一些更重要的事：他们需要不断追问自己，团队合作是否是完成这项工作的最佳途径。
sentences.en: However, organisations need to learn something bigger than how to manage teams better: they need to be in the habit of asking themselves whether teams are the best tools for the job.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 管理松懈的团队是滋生混乱的温床——员工常常抱怨开会占用了太多时间，或者办公室环境嘈杂，使得他们没法完成工作。
sentences.en: Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction—employees routinely complain that they can’t get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 第一波试销结果令 ConAgra 的团队也颇感惊讶。
sentences.en: The first test market results surprised even the ConAgra team.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 第三, 团队成员乐于再次一起工作.
sentences.en: Third, team members remain committed to working together again.

sentences.cn: 我对我们的团队很有信心.
sentences.en: I have confidence in our team.

sentences.cn: 在投入新产品时领导内部团队.
sentences.en: Leads internal AQP teams in launching of new products.

sentences.cn: 你们会成为CLR托管服务开发团队中的关键开发者.
sentences.en: You will be a key developer working on the CLR managed services team.

sentences.cn: 经研讨活动,团队教师将资讯科技的功能活用于教学之中.
sentences.en: The team of teachers activated the functions of IT in teaching by way of seminar activities.

sentences.cn: 有关工作组的重要信息,请参阅公告.
sentences.en: See bulletins about information important to the team.

sentences.en: Teams of international medical workers are in Angola.

sentences.cn: 项目工作组通常包括有项目工程师 、 设计工程师 、 计划工程师 、 以及各类专家.
sentences.en: The project team normally consists of project engineer, design engineer, schedule engineer, and various specialists.

sentences.cn: 大学毕业, 我被委派参加了世界银行贷款项目工作组.
sentences.en: After graduation, I was assigned into a team working for a World Bank loan project.

sentences.cn: 这需要奥组委由初始阶段的单个职能部门演变为后期的综合场馆工作组.
sentences.en: This necessitates orchestrating the evolution of the OCOG from individual al areas to integrated venue teams.

sentences.cn: 创建子网站,例如工作组网站 、 会议工作区网站和文档工作区网站.
sentences.en: Create subsites such as team sites & # 44 ; Meeting Workspace sites & # 44 ; and Document Workspace sites.

sentences.cn: 专家团队将和工作组一起起草生活技能培训包.
sentences.en: The Advisory Team working with the Working Group to draft the Life Skills Training Package.

sentences.cn: 上级派工作组到该厂进行安全生产检查.
sentences.en: The superior sent a work team to that factory to check its production safety.

sentences.cn: 为了使蝙蝠车的顶棚能够打开和关闭,专门成立了一只工作组, 他们建造了令一辆蝙蝠车.
sentences.en: To make all of that origami fold and unfold, a separate team built yet another Batmobile.

sentences.cn: 我们安排了该工作组参观我们的总部。
sentences.en: We fixed for the team to visit our headquarters.

sentences.cn: 如果团队是由来自等级制组织的经验老到的雇员组成的，这些员 工会习惯于传统的企业文化，那么合作就不会自然地发生，而需要去创造。
sentences.en: When teams consist of experienced employees from hierarchical organizations, who have been conditioned to traditional organizational?culture, cooperation may not occur naturally, it may need to be created.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 此外，这个问题不仅仅是怎样让团队更有效率地合作，更是它如何与它要 服务的整个组织或社会结合在一起。
sentences.en: Furthermore, the issue is not just how the team can function more effectively, but how it integrates with the overall organization, or society that it supposes it serves.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 这一领域的专 家 Casey 称团队内部的合作过程必须要组织好、促进好和管理好。

sentences.en: The Cleveland Clinic, a hospital operator, has reorganised its medical staff into teams to focus on particular treatment areas; consultants, nurses and others collaborate closely instead of being separated by speciality ( 专业)and rank.

sentences.cn: 团队成员共有某种浓厚文化时，团队才能达成最好的合作。
sentences.en: Teams work best if their members have a strong common culture.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 但是，比起如何更好地管理团队，组织机构需要学习一些更重要的事：他们需要不断追问自己，团队合作是否是完成这项工作的最佳途径。
sentences.en: However, organisations need to learn something bigger than how to manage teams better: they need to be in the habit of asking themselves whether teams are the best tools for the job.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 小组合作学习是研究性学习的基本组织形式和主要活动方式.
sentences.en: The team collaborative study is the basic organizational form and main activity manner.

sentences.cn: 良好的人际关系和沟通技能,有良好的团队合作精神.
sentences.en: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to lead by example as a team player and between departments.

sentences.cn: 我和他合作做这项工作.
sentences.en: I teamed up with him to do the work.

sentences.cn: 我的适应能力也很强, 有吃苦耐劳的精神, 也有很高的团队合作精神.
sentences.en: I also have a strong ability to adapt, hardworking spirit, also a high team spirit.

sentences.cn: 与团队合作,成功完成各项人才寻访委托任务.
sentences.en: Cooperate with team members to ensure tasks assigned by clients.

sentences.cn: 工作认真,条理性强,具有团队合作精神, 良好的沟通能力, 思维活跃.
sentences.en: Result oriented, team oriented , self motivated, communication skills, open minded.

sentences.cn: 我们为什么需要团队合作?
sentences.en: Why do we need team work?

sentences.cn: 有较强的团队合作精神, 诚实正直, 能吃苦耐劳, 适应加班要求.
sentences.en: A good team member, honest, hardworking; willing to be overtime.

sentences.cn: 二 、 进取: 主动探索、努力进取, 以合作的团队精神学习探究.
sentences.en: Progress: Explore voluntarily, be aggressive, to learn and explore with team spirit.

sentences.cn: 我们共同合作开始制造游艇.
sentences.en: We teamed up together and began making cabin.

sentences.cn: 这些欧洲学校也采用情景式教学法, 但鼓励团队式的项目合作.
sentences.en: European schools adopted case studies, but encouraged team? based project assignments.

sentences.cn: 优秀的团队合作精神, 项目运作能力及沟通能力.
sentences.en: Good team player, good at project operation and interpersonal communication.

sentences.cn: 遵循产品寿命周期的程序下从事研究, 技术开发,并同相关团队合作.
sentences.en: Contribute to research, technology development following product life cycle procedure, to cooperate with related external team.

sentences.cn: “叠罗汉”被美国人当作一种团队合作精神的游戏, 是共度美好时光最佳选择.
sentences.en: Pyramid considered to be a team building game, also , it's really popular during most fun time!

sentences.cn: 具备优秀的团队合作能力,紧凑的工作期限内完成工作.
sentences.en: Excellent team skills and be able to meet tight deadlines.

sentences.cn: 自我激励, 态度积极,进行团队合作.
sentences.en: Self motivated, positive attitude and able to work as part of a team.

sentences.cn: 良好的沟通技巧和团队合作经验.
sentences.en: Good communication skills and an excellent team player.

sentences.cn: 良好的职业态度, 团队合作精神及领导能力.
sentences.en: Strong commitment, team player and leadership.

sentences.cn: 学生们必须团体合作来选择一个主题,而在课堂上呈现.
sentences.en: Working in teams, students present a communication topic of their choosing to the class.

Sentence.sentence: The late Richard Hackman of Harvard University once argued, I have no question that when you have a team, the possibility exists that it will generate magic, producing something extraordinary… But don't count on it.

Sentence.sentence: The fashion for teams is driven by a sense that the old way of organising people is too rigid for both the modern marketplace and the expectations of employees.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The fashion for teams is also spreading from the usual corporate suspects ( ' , such as GE and IBM) to some more unusual ones.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The Cleveland Clinic, a hospital operator, has reorganised its medical staff into teams to focus on particular treatment areas; consultants, nurses and others collaborate closely instead of being separated by speciality ( ' ,  专业) and rank.

Sentence.sentence: Teamwork is most effective when team members share the same culture.

Sentence.sentence: Teams have become the basic building-blocks of organisations.

Sentence.sentence: Teams are as old as civilisation, of course: even Jesus had 12 co-workers.

Sentence.sentence: Team-building skills are in short supply: Deloitte reports that only 12% of the executives they contacted feel they understand the way people work together in networks and only 21% feel confident in their ability to build cross-functional teams.

Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Leigh Thompson of Kellogg School of Management in Illinois warns that, Teams are not always the answer—teams may provide insight, creativity and knowledge in a way that a person working independently cannot; but teamwork may also lead to confusion, delay and poor decision-making.
